business.headline: Gold prices surge by Rs 900 to Rs 1.07 lakh amid interest rate cut hopesGold of 99.5 per cent purity advanced by Rs 900 to Rs 1,06,100 per 10 grams (inclusive of all taxes) on Friday, from the previous close of Rs 1,05,200 per 10 grams.

India's forex reserves rise by $3.5 billion to $694 billion, says RBIFor the week ended August 29, foreign currency assets, a major component of the reserves, increased by USD 1.686 billion to USD 583.937 billion.
Urban Company and 2 IPOs lined for next week. Check GMP and detailsUrban Company, Dev Accelerator and Shringar House of Mangalsutra will all launch their IPOs on September 10, 2025.

The truth behind "Guaranteed 8–10% Returns": Expert explains the realityMany savers in India are often attracted to insurance plans that promise "guaranteed" returns, offering the appeal of steady growth without exposure to market risks. But do these policies actually deliver what they claim?

Nirmala Sitharaman on GST 2.0, citizen relief, and way forwardIn an exclusive interview with India Today TV, Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman talked about the next-generation GST reforms, GST classification, how the GST reforms benefits will be passed on to common man, the opposition's 'Gabbar Singh Tax' jibe on GST and much more.

Finance Minister on GST Slabs, Medicine Taxes, and US-India Tariff WarFinance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman, during an exclusive interview with India Today TV, addressed public's queries from Lucknow on key economic issues, including GST slabs and international trade tariffs.

Nirmala Sitharaman answers questions on GST reforms from KolkataFinance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman, during an exclusive interview with India Today TV, addressed questions of public from Kolkata regarding recent GST reforms.

Sensex, Nifty end flat as auto sector stocks offset losses by IT sharesThe S&P BSE Sensex was down by just 7.25 points to close at 80,710.76, while the NSE Nifty50 gained a paltry 6.70 points to end at 24,741.00.

Exclusive: Why GST started with 4 slabs? Nirmala Sitharaman explainsWhen GST was launched in 2017, it came with four slabs, 5%, 12%, 18% and 28%. With GST 2.0 now moving to a simpler two-slab system, Nirmala Sitharaman has explained why the original multi-slab structure was necessary.

Exclusive: Will common man get insurance rate cut benefits in GST 2.0? FM answersFinance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman made it clear that the tax relief was introduced for citizens and not for insurance companies.

Popcorn puzzle solved: Nirmala Sitharaman explains GST classificationIn an exclusive interview with India Today TV, Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman explained why salted and chocolate-coated variants had earlier attracted different GST rates.

Why petrol, diesel is still not part of GST? Nirmala Sitharaman answersThe new GST 2.0 promises a simpler, two-rate structure and relief for many sectors. But fuel, petrol and diesel, remains outside its ambit. Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman has explained the reason behind this decision.

entertainment.headline: Bad Girl review: A coming-of-age masterpiece about breaking patriarchal chainsRelease Date:Fri Sep 05, 2025Bad Girl movie review: Director Varsha Bharath's 'Bad Girl' is a fantastic coming-of-age film of a woman. This lovely gem of a film lays bare patriarchy and showcases how women are slowly breaking away from generational trauma.

Rise & Fall: All about Ashneer Grover's reality showA new reality TV show, titled 'Rise & Fall', hosted by entrepreneur Ashneer Grover, is set to stream on Amazon MX Player. Some of the confirmed contestants include Arjun Bijlani, Dhanashree Verma, Kiku Sharda and Kubbra Sait, among others.

Akshay Kumar pledges Rs 5 crore for Punjab flood relief, calls it sewaActor Akshay Kumar has generously pledged Rs 5 crore to support relief efforts in flood-hit Punjab. His timely contribution, alongside heartfelt messages from celebrities like Diljit Dosanjh, brings hope and strength to the resilient people of Punjab during this difficult time.

Ghaati review: Anushka Shetty's comeback film fails to rise above basic tropesRelease Date:Fri Sep 05, 2025Ghaati movie review: Director Krish Jagarlamudi's 'Ghaati', starring Anushka Shetty, Vikram Prabhu and others, is a strictly average tale on exploitation and oppression. The film relies on familiar tropes with very little to look forward to.

Pawan Singh and Aditya Narayan join Ashneer Grover's reality show Rise and FallAmazon MX Player's new reality show 'Rise & Fall' welcomes singer-host Aditya Narayan and Bhojpuri superstar Pawan Singh, promising a thrilling mix of drama and entertainment. The series challenges 15 celebrities to adapt and strategise in a dynamic luxury-versus-bare-basics setting.

Pregnancy was way easier: Patralekhaa opens up on egg-freezing strugglesActor Patralekhaa, expecting her first child with husband Rajkummar Rao, opened up about the difficulties she faced during her egg-freezing journey three years ago, revealing that conceiving naturally was much easier.

The Bengal Files review: Ruthless, hard-hitting but stretched thinRelease Date:Fri Sep 05, 2025The Bengal Files review: Director Vivek Agnihotri's political-thriller 'The Bengal Files' is based on the 1946 Calcutta Killings and the Noakhali riots. Is the film able to do justice to a sensitive subject involving communal tensions and democracy? Here is our review.

How Korean dramas use time travel to explore love, regret and second chancesIn this week's K-fix we will discover how Korean dramas like 'A Time Called You', 'Moon Lovers: Scarlet Heart Ryeo', and 'Couple on the Backtrack' use time travel to explore love, regret, and second chances.

KBC 17: Odisha contestant says father forced her to quit studies for marriageIn the latest episode of 'Kaun Banega Crorepati 17', a contestant from Odisha revealed that she had to give up her job and that her father pressured her to marry at a young age.

Diljit Dosanjh visits Mumbai months after Sardaar Ji 3 rowSinger-actor Diljit Dosanjh made a rare appearance in Mumbai on Thursday. The visit came months after controversy over his film 'Sardaar Ji 3'. The actor recently wrapped filming for 'Border 2'.

Anoushka Shankar calls out body-shaming trolls, champions self-loveAcclaimed sitar maestro Anoushka Shankar has boldly confronted body-shaming remarks on social media, asserting her right to autonomy and self-respect. She shared a series of posts on Thursday.

Shah Rukh Khan aces salt and pepper look in leaked pics from King setsShah Rukh Khan is currently shooting for 'King' in Poland with Arshad Warsi. Pictures of the two stars from the sets have emerged online.

Baaghi 4 review: Tiger Shroff's film is 2.5 hours of coma, and you pay for the bedRelease Date:Fri Sep 05, 2025Baaghi 4 movie review: It is not just another Tiger Shroff action film, it's a close to three-hour hallucination where the story collapses so fast you don't get time to process, care, or even hope for a comeback.

Bigg Boss 19 episode 11: Baseer defeats Abhishek to become new captainBigg Boss 19: Baseer Ali won the captaincy task after a heated argument with Abhishek Bajaj. Earlier in the day, Mridul Tiwari was injured during a task. Kunickaa Sadanand and Tanya Mittal also clashed with each other.

Baaghi 4 X review: Tiger Shroff impresses some, others question his futureSeveral X users have shared their reviews on actor Tiger Shroff's film 'Baaghi 4'. The film released in theatres on September 5 and also features Sanjay Dutt, Sonam Bajwa and Harnaaz Sandhu.

Will the film industry benefit from government's new GST reform? Experts weigh inThe GST 2.0 reforms aim to make cinema tickets cheaper, but experts argue the impact will be minimal as Rs 100 tickets are nearly extinct. While single screens may see slight relief, multiplex audiences are unlikely to benefit.

Madharaasi review: Logic dies, but Sivakarthikeyan lives to tell gun culture taleRelease Date:Fri Sep 05, 2025Madharaasi movie review: Director AR Murugadoss's 'Madharaasi' starring Sivakarthikeyan, Rukmini Vasanth and Vidyut Jammwal, is a commercial actioner on gun culture. While the performances and action sequences win you over, the film's logical loopholes keep it a mediocre entertainer.

Priyanka Chopra, Alia Bhatt cheer for Malayalam hit Lokah: Added to my watchlist'Lokah Chapter 1: Chandra' has made a remarkable impact as Malayalam cinema's first female superhero film, blending mythology with contemporary fantasy to captivate audiences across India. Praised by Bollywood stars and shattering box office records, it heralds a new era for women-led stories in regional cinema.

Not every film can be Saiyaara or Mahavatar Narsimha: KJo defends BollywoodKaran Johar addresses challenges in the Hindi film industry during 'Mirai' press meet. Speaking about 'Saiyaara' and 'Mahavatar Narsimha', he highlights that audience choice ultimately decides a film's success, rejecting any fixed formula or crisis.

general news.headline: India will say sorry in 2 months: Trump aide Howard Lutnick on tariffsUS Commerce Secretary Howard Lutnick predicted that India's defiance over US tariffs is "all bravado" and that New Delhi will eventually be forced to strike a deal with Washington.

Called it Gabbar Singh Tax, now taking credit: Nirmala Sitharaman taunts CongressNirmala Sitharaman, in an exclusive interview, emphasised that during the tenure of Indira Gandhi, India had some of the highest income tax rates in the world.

Trump shares pic of PM, Putin, Xi together: We've lost India, Russia to ChinaThe India-US ties worsened following the 50 per cent tariffs imposed by Trump on New Delhi last month. The US levied 25 per cent base tariffs and another 25 per cent duty over India's continued purchase of Russian oil.

Trump has realised only 50% of the truth on India, ChinaUS President Donald Trump has admitted that the US has "lost" India and Russia to the "darkest" China. While Trump has admitted to 50% of the truth, he hasn't realised the other 50% that he, and solely he, is solely responsible for pushing India towards China with tariffs, nasty rhetoric, and short-sighted diplomacy.

How US's attempt to intercept Kim's calls before 2019 N-talks fell apartIn early 2019, US Navy SEAL Team 6 launched a covert mission on North Korean soil, authorised by Donald Trump, with the objective of installing an electronic device designed to intercept communications from Kim Jong-un.

Jailed MP Engineer Rashid attacked by transgender inmates inside prison: SourcesPrison sources dismissed reports of a murder conspiracy as unfounded, adding that Rashid is currently lodged with three transgender inmates in Tihar Jail.

How pizza deliveries signal US military, political emergencyEarlier this week, when speculation over Donald Trump's alleged death was swirling, the Pentagon Pizza Index surged by 800%. Pizza orders near the Pentagon—the headquarters of the US Defence Department—are considered a barometer, hinting at officials at work for hours, during a crunch situation. This was also the case in June when the US bombed Iran. Even Soviet spies kept an eye on pizza orders during the Cold War.

Will GST rate cuts reflect on MRP or companies loot gains?With GST rate rationalisation, the government is trying to provide relief to the common man and boost the economy. But will companies pass on the benefits to people, or will they pocket the gains? Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman explained on India Today TV why she believes the benefits would be passed on to the aam aadmi.

Ashoka Emblem at J&K's Hazratbal shrine vandalised, Waqf Board chief demands actionA political and religious controversy erupted over the engraving of the national emblem on the renovation plaque at Hazratbal Shrine in Jammu and Kashmir.

India rejects US trade hawk Peter Navarro's misleading, inaccurate remarksMEA spokesperson Randhir Jaiswal firmly rejected Peter Navarro's "Brahmins are profiteering" remark as "inaccurate and misleading."

Taliban's 'no skin contact with males' rule leaves Afghan women under quake rubbleWomen trapped under debris are sometimes left behind while the dead are pulled out, further underscoring how gender rules, not just rubble, are obstructing rescue efforts in a country ruled by the Taliban for the past four years.

Here's how much cheaper Tata cars will get after GST reductionTata Motors will pass on the full benefit of the recent GST reduction to customers, cutting prices across its cars and SUV range by up to Rs 1.55 lakh from September 22, 2025.

Video: Egg hurled at Imran Khan's sister outside Pak jail, 2 women arrestedTwo women were arrested in Rawalpindi for hurling an egg at Imran Khan's sister Aleema Khanum outside Adiala Jail during a Toshakhana case hearing, sparking condemnation and social media reactions.

What's next after GST 2.0? Nirmala Sitharaman on GST 3.0 plansFinance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman has confirmed that GST 2.0, with its new two-slab framework, will begin on September 22. But the bigger question is, what lies ahead in GST 3.0?

Duchess of Kent, oldest living member of Britain's royal family, dies at 92Born Katharine Worsley, she married into the royal family in 1961 after meeting Prince Edward several years earlier while he was posted at a military barracks in northern England.

After 500 rejections, 23-year-old lands OpenAI WFH job, earns Rs 20 lakh monthlyA 23-year-old engineer from Northeast India faced 500+ job rejections before landing a WFH job with OpenAI paying Rs 20 lakh per month. This was a big hike from his earlier Rs 3.6 lakh LPA job, proving remote work can open doors for small-town talent.

'14 Pak terrorists, 400 kg RDX': Mumbai Police on high alert after threat messageThe threat message claimed that human bombs had been planted in 34 vehicles in Mumbai and that the city would be "shaken" after the blasts.

sports.headline: Asia Cup: Sunil Gavaskar believes India's Sanju Samson cannot be left in reservesSunil Gavaskar emphasises Sanju Samson's importance in India's playing XI for Asia Cup 2025. The former captain highlights Samson's versatility amid Shubman Gill's return, signalling a selection challenge ahead.

Shilanand Lakra's journey of resilience: From personal tragedy to Asia Cup heroicsShilanand Lakra returns to Indian hockey after battling severe injuries and personal loss. His goal in the Asia Cup marks a hopeful new chapter in his career.

No animosity to Alexander Isak: Dan Burn reveals players' stance amid Liverpool moveDan Burn expressed no hard feelings towards Alexander Isak after his record-breaking move to Liverpool. Burn understands Isak's ambitions despite disappointment amongst Newcastle fans.

Duleep Trophy: Jagadeesan's 197 powers South Zone to 536, Central Zone in controlNarayan Jagadeesan's near double century helps South Zone build a huge total against North Zone in the Duleep Trophy semifinals. The day saw strong batting performances and a tight contest as Central Zone began their reply to West Zone's big score.

BCCI to hold high-level meet before AGM to decide President, VP candidates: SourcesBCCI prepares for high-stakes elections as leadership meeting set to finalise candidates. Rajeev Shukla, IPL chair prospects, and vice-president roles dominate discussions ahead of AGM in Mumbai later this month.

SA20: Sourav Ganguly's debut as head coach sparks buzz in South AfricaSourav Ganguly will take on the role of head coach of Pretoria Capitals in the upcoming SA20 season. Speaking to the media on Friday, League Commissioner Graeme Smith welcomed Dada to South Africa and explained why no Indian players are part of this year's auction.

BCCI hikes Team India jersey sponsorship rates after Dream11's exitThe BCCI has increased Team India's jersey sponsorship rates, making it costlier for brands to associate with the national team. The revision follows Dream11's exit after the government's Online Gaming Act 2025 came into effect.

Luis Suarez issues apology for spitting incident in Inter Miami's League Cup finalLuis Suarez has apologised for his controversial spitting incident during Inter Miami's Leagues Cup Final loss to Seattle Sounders. He admitted that frustration got the better of him and pledging to make amends as MLS reviews disciplinary action.

MS Dhoni always kept his door open for advice: Dewald Brevis recalls CSK journeyDewald Brevis reflected on his IPL 2025 stint with Chennai Super Kings, calling MS Dhoni's mentorship career-shaping. The South African also enjoyed a record-breaking year in international cricket, including the fastest T20I century by a Proteas batter.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
